posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
I've played on awakening...I don't believe you can take feats like Lasting Insipiration in regular epic levels (21-40) without the pre-reqs, but post 40, you can take feats without the class restrictions if you take that class on a feat level.  e.g. if you take ftr 10 wm 28 rogue 2 up to level 40, if you take Rogue4 on level 42, you can take Improved Evasion as a feat, if you take rogue5 on level 45, you can take defensive roll, then rogue 6 on level 48, you can take epic dodge.  

Since the LL's are pretty custom and there's a lot of custom edits to feats and classes, your best bet is to post on the awakening build forums.  They are still active there.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I realize it may sound like a lot of work on your part, but I don't know any other recourse.

Go through your build, one level at a time, and cite any custom requirements (like the blooded and courteous magrocacy feats to take RDD and the CHA level to take Lasting Inspiration) that impact the decisions you posted.  Also, a starting/final ability level would help a lot.  As much of your own insight into those customizations will help enormously.

If you achieve some additional benefit from WM 10 over WM 7, for example, explain that as well.  Bard can dump skills to just about every skill that WM can so skills should not be a factor with WM levels.  For the time being, unless there is a skill prereq for a particular feat or class selection (like we all know about the default Lore 8 required by RDD and Intimidate 4 for WM), ignore the skills for the moment.  What we want to focus on first is defining the optimal class split, level-up sequence and feat selection, at least for the first 40 levels.  If we get that far, then we can figure what sort of skill set is best for how you intend to play this toon, i.e. party support would be different than solo power.

That's about the best I can offer.

edit:  Ahhh... Dante checked in and offered some server-specific advice.  Very lucky for us all!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I see that your STR and DEX both end at odd numbers. Because of the way the ability bonuses work, you should end them at even numbers if possible.

I also see that Blind Fight is missing. Without it, you are vulnerable to stealthy enemies.

Your DEX-based build is taking Weapon Finesse awfully late.

For a DEX-based WM build, I recommend dropping RDD in favor of Fighter. With Fighter feats available, you can take Blind Fight, Knockdown/IKD, Weapon Spec, and more.
